definition: Guo Moruo (1892-1978), writer, communist party intellectual and cultural apparatchik
outer city wall
surname Guo
foam/suds
to seem/like/as/if

sentences.english: Most chapters of The Collection of Three Leaves by Guo Moruo are the expressions of the writer′s miserable penitence.
sentences.chinese: 《三叶集》大部分篇幅是郭沫若矛盾痛苦心灵的忏悔。

sentences.english: The first chapter is "western art's enlightenment on Guo Moruo's early poetry".
sentences.chinese: 第一章“郭沫若早期诗学受西方文艺的启迪”。

sentences.english: Qu Yuan is a historical play written by Guo Moruo.
sentences.chinese: 《屈原》是郭沫若写的一部历史剧。

sentences.english: Guo Moruo is the modem education thought initiator and the success practice.
sentences.chinese: 郭沫若是现代教育思想的提倡者和成功的践行者。

sentences.english: Guo Moruo always paid great attention to the relation between primitive thinking and creation.
sentences.chinese: 郭沫若历来关注原始思维与诗歌创作的关系。

sentences.english: Guo Moruo is a well-deserved founder of Chinese New Poetry.
sentences.chinese: 郭沫若当之无愧是中国新诗的奠基者。

sentences.english: Guo Moruo is one of the most disputable famous cultural talents in the 20th century in China.
sentences.chinese: 郭沫若是20世纪中国最有争议的文化名人之一。

sentences.english: Guo Moruo's literary thoughts and his literary composition partly inherited from Chuang-tzu.
sentences.chinese: 郭沫若的文艺思想及其创作不同程度地有承于庄子。

sentences.english: On expression of the literary and artistic utilitarian view, Guo Moruo has the obvious contradiction.
sentences.chinese: 郭沫若对文艺的功利观念在表达上存在着明显的矛盾。

sentences.english: They saw a play of Guo Moro's.
sentences.chinese: 他们看了郭沫若的一个剧。

sentences.english: Guo Moruo s historical anti-war dramas have greatly displayed this essence.
sentences.chinese: 郭沫若的抗战史剧，便具有这种优秀品格。

definition: Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Xu Zhimo (1897-1931), writer and poet
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Jian Bozan (1898-1968), Chinese Marxist historian and vice-president of Bejing University 1952-1968
Shen Congwen (1902-1988), novelist
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
Tian Han (1898-1968), author of the words of the PRC national anthem March of the Volunteer Army 義勇軍進行曲|义勇军进行曲
